name: Fix issue #117
body: Fix #117 memory leak caused by holding onto the activity. Thanks to @bomberaya

name: Fix issue #112
body: There was an issue in 2.0.3 that will cause a `NullPointerException` on some devices. It is fixed in this release. Have a look at issue #112

name: Implement option to add Vector Drawable
body: Option added to `setSmallIcon` using vector drawable. You are now able to set the small icon using a byte[], drawable or vector drawable.

name: Fix issue #91
body: The demo application was still checking for `Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE` on devices running 29>. This caused issues that are fixed in this release

name: Fix issue #88 & #89
body: In Android 21, it's required to set a flag to either `FLAG_IMMUTABLE` or `FLAG_MUTABLE` when using a `PendingIntent`. Since the library is not interacting with other applications using the `PendingIntent`, I think it's safe to assume that `FLAG_IMMUTABLE` should be used.

name: Version 2
body:
With all the latest updates, I decided to release version 2.
- Set max duration and file size.
- Better error handling

name: Added setMaxFileSize and more
body: Added setMaxFileSize thanks to @tfrysinger (https://github.com/HBiSoft/HBRecorder/pull/62) and fixed #60

name: Update HBRecorderCodecInfo
body: This is to get more information about your devices supported codecs. This is to assist in finding the cause of #34 where `HBRecorderOnError: 268435556` is called when selecting the default encoder.

name: Add Pause/Resume
body: Devices running Android 24 > can pause/resume a recording by calling `hbrecorder.pauseRecording()` and `hbrecorder.resumeRecording()`. It is important to check if the recording has started before trying to pause it, by calling `hbRecorder.isBusyRecording()`. Likewise, for when resuming a recording, it is important to check if the recording was paused by calling `hbrecorder.isRecordingPaused()`

name: Fix issue #24
body: The previous release caused `HBRecorderOnComplete` to be called twice. This release fixes it.

name: Added HBRecorderOnStart listener
body: This is useful to know when the recording actually starts (After the dialog that gets displayed to the user).

name: Added option to set Uri
body: You can now pass a Uri for the output. You have to make use of `ContentResolver` and `ContentValues`. Have a look at the demo project - https://github.com/HBiSoft/HBRecorder/blob/4c7c52e1f793aae6ad5f3914d2d0a7217d762fe2/app/src/main/java/com/hbisoft/hbrecorderexample/MainActivity.java#L527

name: Add a notification icon of type byte[] for flutter
body: Thank to @FingerArt - https://github.com/HBiSoft/HBRecorder/pull/19

name: Added setOrientationHint
body: Added option to set the output orientation by calling `hbRecorder.setOrientationHint(90);`

name: Migrated to API 29
body: I had a lot of requests to migrate to Android 10. The option to not show a notification is no longer available since we cannot run a `ForgroundService` without displaying a notification. I cleaned up some code as well.

name: Fix issue #6
body: We can not assume that the device supports the screen dimensions. This is now fixed in this release.

name: Error handling
body: Improved error handling/catching.

name: Added and changed a lot
body: With this release, you can now set custom settings. Please read the readme to see all the changes.

name: Lower minSdkVersion
body: I decided to lower the minSdkVersion. This will allow you to import the library into projects that have a minSdkVersion lower than 21. But you will have to check the API version yourself. You can have a look at the demo project to see how I have done this. If your minSdkVersion is 21 > then this is not necessary.

name: Minor improvements
body: Minor adjustments, mainly to avoid possible future crashes.

name: Updates to HBRecorder class
body: Added default parameters when not passing anything to HBRecorder

name: Lightweight screen capturing Android library
body: First release
